content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory Interface at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of:
• Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
• Dedicated factory burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT  
Additional adjacent components noted in the factory setup include a burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) and an assembling-machine-1 at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5).

### Belt Depot Structure at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Belt depot wooden chest at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) (crafted and successfully placed in Step 214)
• Dedicated transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) placed adjacent to the depot chest
• Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction UP placed adjacent to the chest  
These entities form an interconnected depot intended for use as a belt-based item transfer target.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
– When connecting transport belts, ensure the target is a valid inserter rather than a Prototype.SteamEngine. Always add an intermediary inserter for inputting items into the steam engine. This mistake recurred in multiple steps (210, 211, 213, 214, 215, 216, and 217).

• Entity Placement Errors  
– Before placing an entity, move close enough to the target position to avoid “target position is too far” errors.  
– Confirm that the required item exists in the inventory (for example, a wooden chest) to prevent placement failures.

• Variable Reference Errors  
– Verify that all variables (such as the intended target reference like “target_chest”) are correctly defined and referenced to avoid NameErrors.
